abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings convey satisfactory project
            outcomes, likely sustainability, but modes institutional
            development impacts. Lessons address the following. On
            project preparation, it is suggested to ensure sufficient
            political commitment to the program approach, particularly
            on development objectives; an adequate institutional
            capacity, and, most importantly, effective planning and
            management, including regarding the coordination of
            capabilities; and, a focus on key performance indicators,
            with realistic targets. Regarding project implementation,
            recommendations include developing sustainable capacity
            building for the sector, and, to ensure quality, and
            effective management of staff development and teacher
            training activities, the roles and responsibilities of all
            the institutions involved should be clearly identified,
            specifically concerning: human resource development
            strategies, provision of administrative support, provision
            of academic support, monitoring and supervision activities,
            and, curriculum development. Further lessons address program
            aspects, which should be sequenced, and coordinated
            appropriately; and, systematic data collection, and
            utilization to be continuously monitored, and evaluated.

5084029.trustfund:
TF030494-JAPAN CTF FY04 GENERAL: SAR
            (ALL COUNTRIES IN SOUTH ASIA/ALL SECTORS AN,TF023098-PHRD-GENERAL EDUCATION PROJECT II,TF027053-PHRD-PRIMARY EDUCATION SECTOR DEV.PROJ.,TF040839-BANGLADESH: PRIMARY EDUCATION PROJECT

abstracts.cdata!:
The Primary Education Development
            Project's objectives are to: a) improve school quality
            and system efficiency; b) establish a sustainable,
            cost-effective and better managed education system; and c)
            ensure universal coverage and equitable access to quality
            primary schooling.  The first project components --
            improving school quality and system efficiency -- will
            provide teacher development and school cluster based
            training; improve curriculum; and strengthen national
            institutions to ensure quality primary education and teacher
            training.  The second component -- strengthening
            institutional capacity and management -- will be done at
            central, district, thana, and school levels.  Activities
            will focus on strengthening management skills and improving
            information systems.  The third component -- increasing
            equitable access -- will include construction of new schools
            and additional classrooms in under-served areas for
            hard-to-reach children; block grants to schools to support
            the provision of stationery to the poorest students; and
            social mobilization.
